conclusion: Determine the work done by the gas from state B to state C.
The process from B to C is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The pressure at state B and C is 0.6p0.
The volume at state B is 0.5V0.
The volume at state C is V0.
The change in volume, ΔV, is V0 - 0.5V0 = 0.5V0.
For an isobaric process, the work done W is given by W = P ΔV.
The work done by the gas when it changes from state B to state C is 0.3p0V0.
